Herbal Tea and Honey Remedy: Create a blend of herbs like eucalyptus, ginger, and echinacea that have natural decongestant and anti-inflammatory properties. Steep the herbs in hot water and add honey to sweeten. Drink the tea several times a day to help relieve congestion and soothe a sore throat.

Saltwater Gargle: Mix 1/4 teaspoon of salt with 8 ounces of warm water and gargle several times a day to help reduce swelling in the throat and kill bacteria. The saltwater solution can also help loosen mucus and make it easier to expel.

Onion and Garlic Stew: Boil onions and garlic in water until the mixture turns into a thick, syrupy consistency. Strain the mixture and let it cool. Use a cotton ball or swab to apply the mixture to the nose and chest to help break up mucus and ease congestion. The antibacterial properties of onions and garlic can also help fight off infections.

Humidifier and Essential Oils: Use a humidifier to add moisture to the air, which can help loosen mucus and make it easier to breathe. Add a few drops of eucalyptus or peppermint essential oil to the humidifier to help open up airways and ease congestion.

Ginger and Turmeric Tea: Steep fresh ginger and turmeric roots in hot water to create a soothing tea. The anti-inflammatory properties of ginger can help reduce swelling in the throat, while turmeric's antibacterial properties can help fight off infections. Drink the tea several times a day to help relieve cold symptoms.
